section.name: Building and Deploying the Apache Harmony Website

subsection.name: Building
subsection.p:
The following tools are required to build the Harmony website
Subversion
Apache Ant
Java 1.4.2 JDK

ol.li: Download the website source from Harmony subversion repository $ svn checkout https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/harmony/standard/site
Change into the site directory and run the default ant script target $ cd site $ ant

subsection.p: At this point, you have a complete generated website and documentation in the site/docs subdirectory. Open the index.html page and start browsing.

subsection.name: Making Changes
subsection.p: Making changes is straightforward. All edits are made to the contents of the xdocs/ subdirectory, and then rendered via the procedure above into the docs/ directory.

If you are a Harmony committer, you can simply checkin your changes. If you are not a committer, any updates and additions to the site are very welcome. Please see our Get Involved page for instructions on how to contribute your changes.

subsection.name: Deploying to Harmony Website
subsection.p: If you are a Harmony Committer, you can commit your changes into SVN and then publish to the project website. Once the changes are in SVN, simply :

ol.li: SSH to minotaur.apache.org $ ssh geirm@minotaur.apache.org Your login name will of course be your own.
Go to the project website directory. $ cd /www/incubator.apache.org/harmony/

Update the local copy. There are two ways. A simple $ svn update will update the local copy. If you need to delete the HTML and re-checout use $ `cat UPDATE` as the UPDATE file has the command used to do a fresh svn checkout.
